{"step_by_step_thinking": "Infective endocarditis is an infection of the inner surface of the heart, usually the valves, caused by bacteria entering the bloodstream and settling in the heart. Pseudomonas is a type of bacteria that is often associated with infections in people with weakened immune systems or those who are in hospital settings. Intravenous drug abuse is a common risk factor for infective endocarditis because it can introduce bacteria directly into the bloodstream. Pentazocin is a drug that is often abused intravenously.
